strategy: Necron armies have a Strategy Rating of 1
Initiative: All Necron formations have an Initiative Rating of 1+
usage: The following army list allows you to field an army based on the Necrons of the Maynarkh Dynasty

formations.name: 0–1 Tomb Complex
formations.units: The first objective the Necron player places on their own table edge functions both as a Portal and as an objective. It may not be destroyed. Formations using the Portal should measure from the edge of the board as the formation’s starting point.

sections.name: Maynarkh Dynasty Core Formations
sections.description: A Necron army must contain at least one 'The Unbidden' formation, but no more than than the number of Necron Phalanx formations

formations.name: Necron Phalanx
formations.units: Seven Necron Warriors and one Necron Lord
extraUnits: (0-1 per army) Replace the Necron Lord with a Necron Overlord: 75 points
(0-1 per army) Add one C'tan Shard: 75 points
Add up to two Tomb Spyders: 50 points for one, 75 points for two
Add up to two Wraiths: 25 points each

sections.name: Maynarkh Dynasty Support Formations
sections.description: Up to two for each Necron Phalanx

formations.name: Obelisk Phalanx
extraUnits: Add up to two Obelisks: 50 points each

formations.name: Eques Phalanx
formations.units: Any six of the following units: Destroyers, Heavy Destroyers
extraUnits: Replace one Destroyer with a Necron Destroyer Lord: 25 points
Add up to two Tomb Spyders: 50 points for one, 75 points for two
Add up to two Wraiths: 25 points each

formations.name: Monolith Phalanx
extraUnits: Add up to one Monolith: 75 points
Add up to one Obelisk: 50 points

formations.name: Stalker Maniple
extraUnits: Replace up to two Triarch Stalkers with Seraptek Heavy Constructs: 75 points each

sections.name: Maynarkh Dynasty Harvesters
sections.description: Up to a third of the points available may be spent on these formations

formations.name: 0–1 Harvester Engine
extraUnits: Replace the Æonic Orb with an Abbatoir: 100 points
